korean: 오늘 저녁에 길거리 음식 투어 다녀왔는데, 진짜 배터지게 먹었어.
친구랑 시장 근처부터 시작했는데, 사람이 진짜 많더라.
떡볶이 냄새부터 풍기는 게, 참을 수가 없었어.
첫 번째로 떡볶이랑 순대 시켰는데, 국물이 진짜 얼큰해.
막 먹다가 튀김도 추가로 시켰는데, 바삭바삭하니 맛있어.
배가 차는데도 다음 가게로 넘어갔어, 호떡 냄새 때문에.
호떡은 갓 구운 거라 뜨거워서 입천장 데일 뻔했어.
속에 설탕이 녹아서 나오는 게, 진짜 달달해.
친구가 붕어빵도 먹자고 해서, 또 샀는데.
팥 vs 크림 논쟁 끝에 둘 다 사버렸어.
배가 진짜 부른데 또 보이는 게 있어, 타코야키.
일본 음식이긴 한데, 여기서 파는 거 먹어봤는데 의외로 괜찮아.
마지막으로 따뜻한 군고구마 하나 들고 집에 가는 길.
계단 오르는 게 힘들 정도로 배불러.
돈은 좀 썼는데, 행복했으니까 후회 없어.
english: I went on a street food tour tonight, and I literally ate until I was stuffed.
My friend and I started near the market, and there were so many people.
The smell of tteokbokki was wafting through the air, I couldn't resist.
First we ordered tteokbokki and sundae, and the broth is really spicy.
While eating we also added fried food, and it's so crispy and delicious.
Even though I was getting full, we moved to the next place because of the hotteok smell.
The hotteok was freshly made so it was hot, I almost burned the roof of my mouth.
The sugar inside was melting and coming out, it's so sweet.
My friend said let's get bungeoppang too, so we bought that again.
After the red bean vs cream debate, we just bought both.
I'm really full but I see something else, takoyaki.
It's Japanese food, but I tried the one they sell here and it's surprisingly good.
Finally, I'm walking home with a warm roasted sweet potato.
I'm so full that climbing stairs is hard.
I spent some money, but I'm happy so no regrets.
